history.content:
Yes, I would recommend you to do this. Stat134+SLC's adjunct works just as well. I was in a similar situation, desperate to clutch an A- to declare, so I studied 70 in advance the break prior to taking it and took 134+adjunct in the same semester and managed an A- (missing A just a tiny bit) to declare. 

IMO, it is never redundant to take stat134 or stat140 on top of 70 as I believe that it is extremely unlikely for one to learn probability well enough from 70 alone. Most learn it just well enough to get by the 70 exams, while forgetting most of it right after due to the blistering pace at which it is covered in the course.

Just work hard at your goal and don't overthink it. Just saying, a CS major will not make or break your future SWE career. Good luck!

children.subject: thanks Aishani! (For both this well thought out comment and for all your help in 61b this semester!)

Hi OP, I was recommended to take a stat class with/before 70 as well (ended up not doing it bc scheduling issues) and it definitely would have helped since the probability goes quite fast! If you can't manage to make that happen though, I would still recommend prepping probability beforehand, and a TA from 70 recommended this book to me which I think is quite good. IIRC they solve some of the problems different from how 70 teaches you to solve them (like for some dice problems they hand-count the sample space, etc) but it's great to go over prob concepts before jumping into them during class.

probable_tea.pdf it's called Introduction to Probability by Dimitri P. Bertsekas and John N. Tsitsiklis, in case piazza screws up my file. A- will take you effort to do if you don't have prior knowledge in 70-related things but it is totally possible. Feel free to dm me or something if you wanna chat about 70 (lowkey favorite class I've taken here lmao), but also I agree with the student answer in that it's not the end of the world if you're unable to declare :))

thanks so much to the student answer for such a great and helpful comment. You're an inspiration. nice knowing that another stressed out individual succeeded in the same situation as me. Wish me luck :)

My advice would be taking 140 and 70 together, along with a breadth. Depending on the workload you're used to, that might be a bit rough, but it's a great way to do well in the second half of 70. I had a friend who did it this semester and it paid off for her

history.content:
Hi, I need an A- in CS70 to declare. Is it true that Stat 140 prepares you for the probability portion of CS70? Would you advise doing this?  

Also, how hard is it to get an A- or better in CS70. When I do take CS70, I'll be able to make it my only technical class. Be brutally honest with me. Thanks!
history.subject: Stat 140 for CS70?
